\ 00822 break; \ 00823 SFV_64 \ 00824 default: \ 00825 (data)->value = NULL; \ 00826 } 00827 #ifdef ALLOW_64BITS 00828 #define SFV_64 \ 00829 case IEC_T_ULINT: \ 00830 *((uint64_t*)((data)->value)) = *((uint64_t*)val); \ 00838 break; 00839 #else 00840 #define SFV_64 00841 #endif 00849 #define IEC_ANYTYPE(type) \ 00850 (ANY_NUM(type)) \ 00851 | (ANY_DATE(type) << 1) \ 00852 | (ANY_BIT(type) << 2) \ 00853 | (ANY_REAL(type) << 3) \ 00854 | (ANY_STRING(type) << 4) \ 00855 | (ANY_ELEMENTARY(type) << 5) \ 00856 | (ANY_MAGNITUDE(type) << 6) \ 00857 | (ANY_INT(type) << 7) \ 00858 | (ANY_INTEGRAL(type) << 8) \ 00859 | (ANY_UNSIGNED(type) << 9) \ 00860 | (ANY_SIGNED(type) << 10) \ 00861 | (ANY_CHAR(type) << 11) \ 00862 | (ANY_CHARS(type) << 12) 00863 00869 #define iec_anytype_allowed(data, A, B, C, D, E, F) \ 00870 if((data) == NULL || !((data)->any_type & (A ## _BIT | B ## _BIT | C ## _BIT | D ## _BIT | E ## _BIT | F ## _BIT))) \ 00871 return IEC_NAT 00872 00878 #define iec_type_allowed(data, A) \ 00879 if(data == NULL || !((data)->type == (A))) \ 00880 return IEC_NAT 00881 00882 // TODO: INCOMPLETE! 00888 #define iec_fit(data, value) \ 00889 ((data)->type == IEC_T_BOOL) \ 00890 || ((data)->type == IEC_T_F_EDGE) \ 00891 || ((data)->type == IEC_T_R_EDGE) ? (value >= UCHAR_MIN) && (value <= UCHAR_MAX) && (round(val) == value) : \ 00892 ((data)->type == IEC_T_SINT) ? (value >= SCHAR_MIN) && (value <= SCHAR_MAX) && (round(val) == value) : \ 00893 ((data)->type == IEC_T_USINT \ 00894 || (data)->type == IEC_T_BYTE) ? (value >= UCHAR_MIN) && (value <= UCHAR_MAX) && (round(val) == value) : \ 00895 ((data)->type == IEC_T_INT) ? (value >= INT_MIN) && (value <= INT_MAX) && (round(val) == value) : \ 00896 ((data)->type == IEC_T_UINT) \ 00897 || ((data)->type == IEC_T_WORD) ? (value >= UINT_MIN) && (value <= UINT_MAX) && (round(val) == value) : \ 00898 ((data)->type == IEC_T_DINT) ? (value >= ULONG_MIN) && (value <= ULONG_MAX) && (round(val) == value) : \ 00901 ((data)->type == IEC_T_REAL) ? 0 : \ 00902 ((data)->type == IEC_T_TIME) ? 0 : \ 00903 ((data)->type == IEC_T_LREAL) ? 0 : \ 00904 FT_64(data) 00905 #ifdef ALLOW_64BITS 00906 #define FT_64(data) \ 00907 ((data)->type == IEC_T_ULINT) ? 0 : \ 00908 ((data)->type == IEC_T_LINT) \ 00909 || ((data)->type == IEC_T_LWORD) ? 0 : \ 00910 ((data)->type == IEC_T_POINTER) ? 0 : \ 00911 0 00912 #else 00913 #define FT_64(data) 0 00914 #endif 00915 00921 #define iec_timer(v) ((t_timer_t*)((v)->value)) 00923 00931 static inline void iec_new_value(void **nw, iectype_t type) { 00932 switch (type) { 00933 case IEC_T_F_EDGE: 00934 case IEC_T_R_EDGE: 00935 case IEC_T_BOOL: 00936 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(bool)); 00937 break; 00938 00939 case IEC_T_SINT: 00940 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(int8_t)); 00941 break; 00942 00943 case IEC_T_USINT: 00944 case IEC_T_BYTE: 00945 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(uint8_t)); 00946 break; 00947 00948 case IEC_T_INT: 00949 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(int16_t)); 00950 break; 00951 00952 case IEC_T_UINT: 00953 case IEC_T_WORD: 00954 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(uint16_t)); 00955 break; 00956 00957 case IEC_T_DINT: 00958 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(int32_t)); 00959 break; 00960 00961 case IEC_T_UDINT: 00962 case IEC_T_DWORD: 00963 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(uint32_t)); 00964 break; 00965 00966 case IEC_T_REAL: 00967 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(float)); 00968 break; 00969 00970 case IEC_T_LREAL: 00971 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(double)); 00972 break; 00973 00974 case IEC_T_TIME: 00975 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(double)); 00976 break; 00977 00978 case IEC_T_DATE: 00979 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(date_t)); 00980 break; 00981 00982 case IEC_T_TOD: 00983 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(tod_t)); 00984 break; 00985 00986 case IEC_T_CHAR: 00987 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(char)); 00988 break; 00989 00990 case IEC_T_WCHAR: 00991 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(wchar_t)); 00992 break; 00993 00994 case IEC_T_STRING: 00995 case IEC_T_WSTRING: 00996 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(string_t)); 00997 break; 00998 #ifdef ALLOW_64BITS 00999 case IEC_T_DT: 01000 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(dat_t)); 01001 break; 01002 01003 case IEC_T_ULINT: 01004 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(uint64_t)); 01005 break; 01006 01007 case IEC_T_LINT: 01008 case IEC_T_LWORD: 01009 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(int64_t)); 01010 break; 01011 01012 case IEC_T_POINTER: 01013 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(pointer_t)); 01014 break; 01015 #endif 01016 case IEC_T_TABLE: 01017 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(table_t)); 01018 break; 01019 01020 case IEC_T_USER: 01021 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(user_t)); 01022 break; 01023 case IEC_T_TIMER: 01024 (*nw) = malloc(sizeof(t_timer_t)); 01025 break; 01026 01027 default: 01028 (*nw) = NULL; 01029 break; 01030 } 01031 } 01032 01040 static inline void iec_init(iec_t *nw, iectype_t type) { 01041 (*nw)->type = type; 01042 (*nw)->any_type = IEC_ANYTYPE(type); 01043 (*nw)->tt = 0; 01044 iec_new_value(&((*nw)->value), type); 01045 } 01046 01053 static inline void iec_free_value(iec_t *var) { 01054 if ((*var) == NULL) 01055 return; 01056 if ((*var)->type != IEC_T_NULL) 01057 free((*var)->value); 01058 } 01059 01066 static inline void iec_deinit(iec_t *var) { 01067 iec_free_value(var); 01068 free(*var); 01069 } 01070 01078 static inline void iec_totype(iec_t *data, uint8_t tpy) { 01079 void *_tmp_ = NULL; 01080 uint8_t tp_old = (*data)->type; 01081 01082 if (ANY_NUM(tp_old) || ANY_BOOL(tp_old)) { 01083 iec_new_value(&_tmp_, tp_old); 01084 iec_set_value_type(_tmp_, iec_get_value(*data), tp_old); 01085 } 01086 01087 (*data)->type = tpy; 01088 (*data)->any_type = IEC_ANYTYPE(tpy); 01089 01090 iec_free_value(data); 01091 if (!ANY_STRING(tp_old)) { 01092 iec_new_value(&((*data)->value), tpy); 01093 } 01094 01095 if (ANY_NUM(tp_old) || ANY_BOOL(tp_old)) { 01096 iec_set_value((*data), iec_get_value_type(_tmp_, tp_old)); 01097 free(_tmp_); 01098 } 01099 } 01100 01108 static inline void iec_type_promote(iec_t *data, uint8_t tpy) { 01109 if ((*data)->type < tpy) { 01110 iec_totype(data, tpy); 01111 } 01112 } 01113 01114 #endif /* IEC61131LIB_H_ */
